page.title: 05Three Local Churches
page.content: St. Pauls church belongs to our school and also has a Sunday School. The Mother's Union, the school and the Sunday School also use the church. About thirty babies are christened there each year. Only two or three couples are married per year in the church. Some of the children of the school were baptised at the church. Ebenezer Baptist Church was built on the site of an iron foundry in 1856, in Peel Street. Mr.MacGregor the pastor, and the elders own the church. The church has a Sunday school with about 25 children and a mother and toddlers group. St.Anne's New Memorial Church is a Roman Catholic Church. The priest there likes to be called father. The church is 60 years old and is in the shape of a horizontal cross.
